name: P.P. Tubbs Hay, Feed, and Coal
description: P.P. Tubbs was a local businessman who sold hay, feed, and coal.

name: Plattner Implement Company
description: Manufacturers and jobbers of agricultural machinery and supplies. Standing in the doorway is George Plattner.

name: <name?> Bicycle Shop
description: In several old photos. Dates approximate.

name: Square Deal Garage
description: Owned by Con Stitzman. dates TBD

name: Reliable Auto Service
description: Owned by Les Thompson. dates TBD

name: Johny Ayres Greasing and Washing
description: A local car wash and lube shop (seems to have bounced between 247 and 253 Linden). Employeed an 18 year old Joe Cienfuegos, who would go on to own Joes Upholstery, next door.

name: Summers Auto Repair.
description: Summers Auto appears in the 1959, 1966, 1969 city directory. They moved to Link Lane some time in the 1970s?

name: Gallery 251, The Garage
description: A group of CSU fine art students were my first tenant. Special thanks to artist ChrisNelsonArtist.com for providing photos and dates!

name: Todd's Guitars
description: By far the most stunningly beautiful tentant experience. Todd briefly expanded from his still-extant Longmont Colorado store.

name: Baudin Ganze Consulting Engineers
description: A local engineering firm specializing in lighting and electrical design and consulting. They were the first and only tenant to occupy the top floor after reconstruction.

name: May 1, 2006. Father & Son Art Exhibit (between major tenant transition)
description: A one-day art exhibit featuring the work Darren Gennetten and his father, Douglas Gennetten.

name: Walnut Street Art Gallery
description: A local art gallery showcasing Rock and Roll art.

name: Luscious Nectar
description: A local juice bar specializing in vodka-infused smoothies.

name: Old Town Distilling
description: An evoluton of Luscious Nectar, Old Town Distilling was a local distillery and tasting room.

name: The Reserve by Old Elk
description: A local distillery and tasting room.
